title: Science Gifted Education Program Utilizing Advanced Laboratory Equipment Based on the Group Inquiry Model

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational knowledge of high school-level chemistry experiments and introductory college-level science lab experience
context.additional_context: Operated as a program linked to university-affiliated science gifted education centers or undergraduate advanced courses.

learning_goals: Students can collaboratively design experiments to solve scientific problems using advanced laboratory equipment.
Learners can integrate diverse scientific knowledge while establishing a knowledge-sharing system during group inquiry processes.
Participants can systematically analyze and visualize experimental results, write reports, and conduct peer evaluations.

resources: Advanced Laboratory Tools (Spectrophotometer, Chromatography Equipment, etc.)
Digital Collaboration Platforms (e.g., Notion, Google Workspace)
Science Laboratory Safety Equipment and Manuals

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
